articles.title: Post his World Cup triumph, Lisandro Martinez misses friend’s wedding to return to Manchester United
articles.description: The 24-year-old was invited to Nicolas Tagliafico's wedding to girlfriend Carolina Calvagni back in their native Argentina. Nicolas Tagliafico is a La Albiceleste teammate and former Ajax teammate.
articles.content:

articles.title: Russian Women are Flying to This South American Country to Give Birth, Get Second Citizenship
articles.description: As the Russian aggression against Ukraine continues for a year, hundreds of Russian women are travelling to Argentina to give birth. Around 2,000-2,500 Russians moved to Argentina in 2022 and many of them were Russian women planning to give birth.
articles.content:
Hundreds of Russian women are travelling to Argentina to give birth as Moscow’s aggression against Ukraine continues for around a year.
Since the start of the Ukraine war last year in February, the South American country has experienced a boom in Rus... [2119 chars]

articles.title: Colombian fan got Messi tattoo on forehead after Argentina FIFA World Cup win. He regrets it now
articles.description: On December 21, Mike Jambs, an influencer from Colombia, posted a video of getting Messi inked on his forehead in a large font.
articles.content: When Argentina lifted the FIFA World Cup 2022, it was not only a dream come true for Argentinian supporters but many fans all over the world who grew up supporting Lionel Messi. Many fans felt that Messi fulfilled his legacy and etched his name in fo... [1430 chars]

articles.title: GRAINS-Soybeans rise as drought threaten Argentine crop; wheat dips
articles.description: SINGAPORE, Jan 4 (Reuters) - Chicago soybean futures rose on Wednesday, recouping some of last session's losses, as concerns over a lack of rains in top supplier Argentina supported prices.Corn also ticked higher, while wheat prices eased.FUNDAMENTALS* The most-active soybean contract on the Chicago Board of Trade (CBOT) added 0.5% to $14.99-1/2 a bushel, as of 0115 GMT, corn
articles.content:
SINGAPORE, Jan 4 (Reuters) - Chicago soybean futures rose on Wednesday, recouping some of last session's losses, as concerns over a lack of rains in top supplier Argentina supported prices.
Corn also ticked higher, while wheat prices eased.
